articles.title: Almost 50,000 excess deaths estimated globally due to disrupted routine vaccinations: Study - ETHealthWorld
articles.description: Of these additional deaths, more than 30,000 are predicted from Africa and around 13,000 from Southeast Asia -- largely due to disruption to measles vaccine coverage. Globally, a little over 44,500 excess deaths are estimated to be due to the disruption to me…
articles.content: New Delhi: Close to 50,000 additional deaths globally are estimated between 2020 and 2030 due to pandemic-related disruptions to immunisation, new research published in The Lancet Global Health journ… [+1760 chars]

articles.author: Dylan Butts
articles.title: East Asia's growth is faster than the rest of the world but China headwinds weigh, World Bank says - CNBC
articles.description: Growth in developing East Asia and Pacific is outpacing the rest of the world, but the region will likely see slower growth in 2024, the World Bank says.
articles.content:
As inflation continues to impact global economies, Asia-Pacific is the only region that will see real salary growth in 2023, according to ECA International.
